Instruction: Rinse green lentils under cold water and drain.
In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add chopped onion, carrot, celery, and minced garlic to the pot. Cook until softened.
Add rinsed green lentils, vegetable broth, bay leaf, ground cumin, ground coriander, salt, and black pepper to the pot.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 30-40 minutes or until the lentils are tender.
Remove the bay leaf from the soup.
Using an immersion blender, blend a portion of the soup until creamy while leaving some lentils whole.
Taste and adjust seasoning if needed.
